com.revature.jfbennatt.ers.daos

Interface EmployeeDao

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmployeeDaoPostgres

    public interface EmployeeDao
    DAO interface for interacting with the database.
    Author:
    Jared F Bennatt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean deleteSessionToken(java.lang.String token)
      Attempts to delete the plain text token from the database.
      Employee getEmployeeByEmail(java.lang.String email)
      Gets an employee from their email.
      Employee getEmployeeByToken(java.lang.String token)
      Finds an employee based on their session token.
      int getTokenLength()
      Returns the length (in chars) that this implementation uses for the session token.
      boolean setTokenById(int empId, java.lang.String token)
      Sets the token for this employee.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteSessionToken

        boolean deleteSessionToken(java.lang.String token)
        Attempts to delete the plain text token from the database.
        Parameters:
        token - Session token of the user that will be deleted (the token, not the user).
        Returns:
        Whether or not the token was actually deleted

      • getEmployeeByEmail

        Employee getEmployeeByEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Gets an employee from their email. This is intended to be used to log in an employee and thus this method should set (at a minimum) the password, id, and first and last name of the Employee object being returned.
        Parameters:
        email - Email of the employee.
        Returns:
        An Employee object representing the employee or null if the employee doesn't exist.

      • getEmployeeByToken

        Employee getEmployeeByToken(java.lang.String token)
        Finds an employee based on their session token. This method should set every field in the returned Employee object except the password.
        Parameters:
        token - Session token of the employee (theoretically the employee would have already logged in and received a session token).
        Returns:
        Employee object representing the employee or null if the session token is invalid.

      • getTokenLength

        int getTokenLength()
        Returns the length (in chars) that this implementation uses for the session token.
        Returns:
        length (in chars) of the session token.

      • setTokenById

        boolean setTokenById(int empId,
                     java.lang.String token)
        Sets the token for this employee.
        Parameters:
        empId - Employee id of the employee to set the token for.
        token - Session token for this employee
        Returns:
        Whether or not this was successful.
